brief_rationale: Universally known process of plants converting light to energy; taught in every basic science class.
Darwin's foundational mechanism of evolution; widely known cultural and scientific concept.
Broadly familiar ecological concept of interacting organisms and their environment.
The basic unit of life; universally taught in elementary science education.
The molecule of heredity; iconic scientific concept known to virtually everyone.
Foundational biological theory of change over time; universally recognized concept.
Widely known infectious agent; universally familiar from everyday health discussions.
Well-known concept of species dying out; familiar from dinosaurs and conservation discourse.
Basic ecological interaction universally understood from nature documentaries and everyday knowledge.
Classification of organisms into groups; kingdom/phylum/class hierarchy is widely taught.
Basic evolutionary concept of organisms becoming suited to their environment; widely understood.
Well-known biological term for chemical processes sustaining life; familiar from health and diet contexts.
Universally known bodily defense system; familiar from everyday health discussions.
Specific ecological relationship type requiring knowledge of mutualism, parasitism, and commensalism distinctions.
Specific evolutionary pattern requiring understanding of independent trait development across lineages.
Linnaean naming system requiring knowledge of genus-species format and taxonomic conventions.
Specific ecological concept requiring understanding of disproportionate ecosystem influence.
Specific thermoregulation strategy requiring knowledge of metabolic heat production mechanisms.
Specific neurophysiology term requiring knowledge of nerve impulse propagation mechanisms.
Specific biology term requiring understanding of observable characteristics vs. genotype distinction.
Specific organelle requiring knowledge of photosynthetic compartmentalization in plant cells.
Specific plant classification requiring knowledge of flowering plant characteristics and reproductive biology.
Major animal classification requiring knowledge of phyla lacking a vertebral column.
Specific term for disease-causing organisms requiring knowledge of bacterial, viral, and fungal agents.
Specific ecological term requiring knowledge of energy flow positions in food webs.
Specific chronobiology term requiring knowledge of 24-hour biological cycles and their mechanisms.
Phylogenetic classification method requiring working knowledge of shared derived characters and tree-building.
Evolutionary mechanism requiring working knowledge of inclusive fitness and altruism toward relatives.
Ecological law (Gause's law) requiring working knowledge of niche theory and interspecific competition.
Biogeochemical cycle requiring working knowledge of nitrogen fixation, nitrification, and denitrification.
Evolutionary mechanism requiring working knowledge of intersexual and intrasexual selection dynamics.
Life history strategy framework requiring working knowledge of reproductive trade-offs and population ecology.
Specific symbiotic relationship requiring working knowledge to distinguish from mutualism and parasitism.
Comparative anatomy concept requiring working knowledge of shared ancestry vs. convergent analogous structures.
Community ecology process requiring working knowledge of primary vs. secondary succession and climax communities.
Study of species distribution requiring working knowledge of dispersal, vicariance, and historical factors.
Hormonal regulation system requiring working knowledge of glands, hormones, and feedback mechanisms.
Population ecology concept requiring working knowledge of logistic growth and resource limitation.
Mathematical condition for altruism evolution requiring deep knowledge of rB > C inequality and inclusive fitness theory.
Evolutionary tempo model requiring deep knowledge of stasis, rapid speciation, and the Eldredge-Gould debate.
Evo-devo field requiring deep knowledge of how developmental gene regulation shapes evolutionary change.
Coevolutionary arms race hypothesis requiring deep knowledge of host-parasite dynamics and sexual reproduction advantages.
MacArthur-Wilson theory requiring deep knowledge of species-area relationships, colonization, and extinction rates.
Specific mimicry system requiring deep knowledge of model-mimic-dupe dynamics and frequency dependence.
Evolutionary relationship inference requiring deep knowledge of tree construction methods and molecular vs. morphological data.
Speciation mode requiring deep knowledge of geographic isolation mechanisms and reproductive barrier formation.
Niche theory requiring deep knowledge of Hutchinsonian hypervolumes, fundamental vs. realized niches.
Ecogeographic rule requiring deep knowledge of body size-latitude correlations and thermoregulatory explanations.
Reciprocal evolutionary change requiring deep knowledge of diffuse vs. specific coevolution and arms race dynamics.
Biogeographic boundary requiring deep knowledge of faunal realms, plate tectonics, and Alfred Russel Wallace's work.
